item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverBreakThrough News

What’s the number one rule on Wall Street?

Rich people aren’t allowed to lose money.

BT’s Kei Pritsker explains how the financial system conspired to crush ordinary GameStop investors.

item.title: WATCH & SHARE - Full documentary In Defense of Justice in...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

WATCH & SHARE - Full documentary In Defense of Justice in Denver, a film about the crackdown on the leaders of the peaceful movement for #JusticeforElijahMcClain

BreakThrough News

The only people charged over the brutal police murder of Elijah McClain are community activists who organized mass peaceful demonstrations calling for justice. ...They are facing up to 48 years in prison - among the highest charges for peaceful political protest in recent history.

#JusticeForElijahMcClain #DropTheChargesCO

item.title: ⚠️⚠️ Evictions are gearing up again ⚠️⚠️...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

⚠️⚠️ Evictions are gearing up again ⚠️⚠️ Governor Polis allowed the state eviction moratorium to expire on January 1, knowing that it would mean the resumption of many evictions where there are gaps in the federal moratorium.

Once the federal moratorium expires, over 15% of Coloradans may face eviction.

PSL has been going door-to-door talking to people about the dire housing crisis, and we are already coming across eviction notices.

...

If we are to prevent masses of evictions—evictions in the millions—we need to fight to demand REAL relief policies from the government. No evictions, no foreclosures, and CANCELLATION of rent and mortgage payments.

This Saturday is a National Day of Action to #CANCELTHERENTS. Denver is joining people in cities and towns all over the country and holding a car protest beginning at 2pm at 3815 Steele St.

RSVP & invite your friends: Cancel the Rents! Denver Car Protest • National Day of Action

See More+3
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: “Right now, the Democratic Party has the power to take...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“Right now, the Democratic Party has the power to take decisive action that would completely marginalize the far right and deal a severe blow to Trump-ism. The Democrats could pass a sweeping set of economic reforms enacting a living wage, canceling rent for the duration of the pandemic, expanding union rights and establishing a system of universal healthcare without needing a single Republican vote in Congress. Joe Biden could cancel student loan debt through executive action. The Biden administration’s Department of Justice could immediately arrest Donald Trump, now a private citizen, for insurrection along with his high-level co-conspirators.”

The Democratic Party is squandering this historic opportunity -- not because they have to, but because they are choosing to. #AssaultontheCapitol #Capitolbuildingattack #COVID19

liberationnews.org

How the Democrats are Throwing Away A Golden Opportunity — Again!

The Democratic Party is squandering this historic opportunity -- not because they have to, but because they are choosing to. #AssaultontheCapitol #Capitolbuildingattack #COVID19The Democratic Party is squandering this historic opportunity -- not because they have to, but because they are choosing to. #AssaultontheCapitol #Capitolbuildingattack #COVID19

item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The extension of the federal eviction moratorium through 3/31 is an important temporary relief measure. But what happens when it expires?

Postponing evictions is NOT ENOUGH!

Join the Jan 30 national day of action to #CanceltheRents!

...

DENVER CAR PROTEST: Saturday 1/30, 2pm, 3815 Steele St. Deck out your car!

item.title: “Unsafe”, “angry”, “disgusted”. This is how the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“Unsafe”, “angry”, “disgusted”. This is how the community feels about the prospect of killer cop Jason Rosenblatt being reinstated.

As Rosenblatt began his hearing before the Aurora Civil Service Commission today to appeal for resinstatement, we asked people to write in how they feel about his appeal. These are just some of the responses:

+3

item.title: “It would be a serious error to think that Biden, a...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“It would be a serious error to think that Biden, a reactionary politician who has pushed right wing positions his entire career, or the team of establishment political operatives and arch-imperialists he has assembled, have had some kind of road to Damascus moment and will now usher in an era of progressive change. Instead, the initial wave of executive orders should be understood as evidence that the Biden White House feels they must build into their political calculations the existence of a formidable left wing capable of playing a major role in the country’s politics."

⚠️ CRITICAL new analysis: What's behind Biden's new package of 17 executive orders?

President Biden signed a package of 17 executive orders immediately following his inauguration on Wednesday. #coronavirus #COVID19 #economy

liberationnews.org

PSL Statement: What’s Behind Biden’s Executive Orders?

item.title: 1PM TODAY - PHONE & EMAIL ZAP ⚡️Today the Aurora Civil...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

1PM TODAY - PHONE & EMAIL ZAP ⚡️Today the Aurora Civil Service Commission will begin hearing a reinstatement appeal from Jason Rosenblatt—the only one of Elijah McClain’s killers to lose his job to date.

To allow this dangerous killer cop back on our streets would be a betrayal of the public. Let the Commission know where the community stands!

We are doing a concentrated zap at 1pm, but encourage people to call and email when they can throughout the day and until we get a de...cision.

https://fb.me/e/1TC4NU8Qm

item.title: Today, just as has happened every four years since 1789, an...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Today, just as has happened every four years since 1789, an avowed defender of the wealth and power of the ruling elite has been sworn into office as President of the United States.

While a great many people are understandably relieved that Donald Trump is leaving the White House, Joe Biden’s Inauguration on its own will do nothing to remedy the urgent crises facing the working class and will do nothing to rein in the destructive role of the U.S. war machine abroad.

Today, just as has happened every four years since 1789, an avowed defender of the wealth and power of the ruling elite has been sworn into office as President of the United States. #congress #imperialism #JoeBiden

liberationnews.org

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSLToday, Martin Luther King Jr.’s name has become...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

Today, Martin Luther King Jr.’s name has become synonymous with the entire Civil Rights Movement, and that movement has been portrayed as just another chapter i...n the unfolding story of constant American progress. Unfortunately, he is rarely remembered for his evolving critique of the U.S. economic system, his dedication to uplifting the poor and his view that mass social movements were needed to continue to transform society.

The rapidly expanding movement used non-violent civil disobedience and the language of freedom to put a spotlight on the hypocrisy of the government’s Cold War rhetoric. At a time when the United States projected itself as beacon of democracy and individual liberty, the “Negro problem” became an international issue that demanded reform.

Thanks to a decade of tireless work, sharp confrontations and the physical sacrifices of millions—most of whose names will never be known—the civil rights movement succeeded at dismantling Jim Crow segregation.

After the Civil Rights Act was passed, Dr. King emphasized how far the country still was from real justice, asking, “What good does it do to sit at the counter when you cannot afford a hamburger?” He was ridiculed for trying to advance the political direction of the movement by calling for more direct action, and dealing directly with economic issues.

Dr. King was dangerous to the political establishment because he started to draw the connection between different struggles and unite them against a common enemy. We cannot protest the war in Afghanistan and forget the racist laws directed at the immigrant community; we cannot fight for women’s rights and not speak to the need for full equality for the LGBTQ community.

When we remember Dr. King, we should remember him not as a speaker at a rally or leader in a demonstration. He was a man attempting to connect the various forms of oppression into a single struggle against social injustice. The only way to remove that injustice is to remove the foundation from which it grows. So let us remember this leader of the Civil Rights Revolution by talking about what it will take to build the next American revolution.

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: This Thursday, call or email the Aurora Civil Service Commission...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

This Thursday, call or email the Aurora Civil Service Commission and remind them that the community has had enough of racist killer cops patrolling our streets. No reinstatement for Jason Rosenblatt!

"Rosenblatt, who is also suing the city as a result of his termination, will argue his case beginning Jan. 21, and Marrero and Dittrich will argue their cases starting Feb. 1.

All three have asked for the hearings to be closed to the public, according to the City. There will be n...o public records available until the commission makes a ruling."

https://kdvr.com/…/petitioners-flood-aurora-civil-service-…/
